main event: Multiple sightings of unusual aerial phenomena near Vaughn, New Mexico, in 1947 and 1948, where mysterious glowing objects were observed descending vertically and bursting into spray and sparks.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright white, reddish-white in color, and descending vertically, with some causing an explosion upon descent.
The sightings were considered separate from 'New Mexico green flashes' due to differences in characteristics, such as the absence of the characteristic green color.
The altitude and distances of the sightings were deemed incompatible with astronomical phenomena, raising the possibility of man-made devices or scientific experiments.
Observations included witness statements of descending balls of light, bursting 100-200 feet from the ground, with no accompanying sound or evidence of conventional aircraft in the vicinity.
The sightings prompted speculation about the potential involvement of scientific experiments or man-made devices common in the region.
sighted object: Unidentified glowing objects, balls of light
